WorkItem.Description:
Steps to Reproduce:
 
   1. Launch Rawr 2.3.22
   2. Tools > Optimize
   3. Set thoroughness to max
   4. Select talents
   5. Click the "optimize" button
   6. Observe that though Omen of Clarity is not selected but the 2pc t10 bonus is still applied.
 
This could lead to moonkins being spec'd out of their 2pc bonus

Comments.Message: This could lead to moonkins being specced out of their 2T10 bonus?  If they can't read the tooltip on their armor, that's their fault, not mine.  I don't think anyone's going to drop Omen of Clarity because "Rawr told me to" and not realize that their 2T10 set bonus requires the presence of the talent.  That being said, it took me longer to type this than it will to fix it.

I really think the whole "optimise talents" thing needs to come with a really big disclaimer.   It is only of limited use and the user needs to understand the limitations of the optimiser and model.   So many of the talents are not modeled as they do not provide an easy DPS value (run speed) or a talent is assumed as all toons of that spec should have it or they are doing it "wrong".

Far better to just use the in-built specs in Rawr (as long as they are updated) or head to EJ's or some such and look at the recommended builds.

In this case, it's possible for a Moonkin to become net mana positive solely from their Moonkin Form returns, which means that all mana talents (including Omen of Clarity) have theoretically 0 value.  But you wouldn't ever want to drop ALL of them.

I agree it would be special for someone to blindly follow it, but I'd still prefer more avenues for people to do it right rather than this be a source of possible disinformation for either uninformed raid-leaders trying to help a moonkin or newly minted moonkins   =)
